info.title: NPR Listening Service
info.description: Audio recommendations tailored to a user's preferences

externalDocs.description: Learn more at the NPR One Developer Center

get.summary: Get a set of recommendations for an aggregation independent of the user's listening history
get.description: This endpoint provides a list of recent audio items associated with the aggregation along with metadata about the aggregation.

parameters.name: aggId
parameters.description: ID of an aggregation such as a program or podcast. If the specified ID is a program that publishes rundowns, the latest rundown will be returned.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: startNum
parameters.description: The result to start with. Allows paging through the episodes of a podcast or program, with the default, `startNum=0`, being the most recent episode. Ignored for programs that publish a rundown.

200.description: A list of audio items from the specified aggregation

get.summary: Get the list of available channels
get.description: These channels allow the user to specify a focus for the content returned in the recommendations endpoint.

parameters.name: exploreOnly
parameters.description: If set to `true`, this call will return only channels that should be shown in the client's `Explore` view

get.summary: Get recent ratings the logged-in user has submitted
get.description: This endpoint provides the list of recently-rated audio recommendations that the logged-in user has consumed. Some rated recommendations are filtered, such as sponsorship and donation.

get.summary: Get a list of recommendations from a category of content from an organization
get.description: This endpoint provides a list of recommendations from a category of content from  an organization.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: ID of an organization, such as an NPR One station

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: One of the three categories of content - newscast, story, or podcast

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

200.description: A list of audio items from a category of content from an organization

post.summary: Collect new ratings for media previously recommended to the logged-in user
post.description:
This endpoint is the main mechanism for providing feedback from the user to NPR about the recommendations that are obtained from `GET /listening/v2/recommendations`.

A fully-populated link to this endpoint is returned with each individual recommendation and is located in the AudioItemDocument under the `links['recommendations']` object. The query parameters in this link should not be modified.
Be sure to copy and send back the entire ratings object (RatingData), as new fields may be added to it in the future.

This endpoint can return a blank JSON.doc or AudioItemDocument depending on the `recommend=true|false` parameter. The `recommend=true` flag allows this endpoint to both receive ratings and send back recommendations in the same call.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: X-Advertising-ID
parameters.description: A device-specific advertising identifier, if possible. Apple's IDFA is an example.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Determines the focus of the recommendations returned. Channel `npr` is recommended for most use cases.

parameters.name: recommend
parameters.description: If set to `false`, this call will return a blank document; otherwise it will return a new recommendation object

requestBody.description: A list of RatingData objects which contains data about ratings such as the id of the content, the rating value, elapsed time and more.

200.description: If the `recommend` param was set to `true`, this returns a list of audio items; otherwise, a blank document is returned.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

get.summary: Get a list of media for the logged-in user from NPR's recommendation engine
get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of audio recommendations. It is designed to be used for an initial list of recommendations, and then `POST /v2/ratings?recommend=true` should be used for subsequent requests for recommendations.

A fully-populated link to the ratings endpoint is returned with each individual recommendation and is located in the AudioItemDocument under the `links['recommendations']` object. The query parameters in this link should not be modified.
Be sure to copy and send back the entire ratings object (RatingData), as new fields may be added to it in the future.

A 500 will be returned if there are no eligible remaining recommendations.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: X-Advertising-ID
parameters.description: A device-specific advertising identifier, if possible. Apple's IDFA is an example.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Determines the focus of the recommendations returned. Channel `npr` is recommended for most use cases.

parameters.name: sharedMediaId
parameters.description: This media was shared directly with the user; if provided, the service will add this recommendation to the top of the list

parameters.name: notifiedMediaId
parameters.description: The user received a push notification about this media; if provided, the service will add this recommendation to the top of the list

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

get.summary: Get a list of recent audio and aggregation items associated with search terms
get.description: In the schema shown below, SearchItemDocument is not an actual type of returned object; the object returned by a search will be either an AggregationAudioItemListDocument or an AudioItemDocument.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your access token from the Authorization Service. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: searchTerms
parameters.description: Search terms to search on; can include URL-encoded punctuation

200.description: A list of audio and aggregation items matching the search query

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

401.description: The client is not authorized to complete this request. Check to ensure a valid access token was passed in the headers.

429.description: The client has exceeded the number of daily calls as per their rate limit. For now, this only applies to prototype applications and untrusted clients. Trusted clients will never be rate-limited, nor will any production apps.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of remaining requests in the current period

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The number of seconds left in the current period

X-RateLimit-Limit.description: The number of allowed requests in the current period

Retry-After.description: The predicted time the system will be back up

content-type.description: The MIME type of the response of this link

daysSinceLastListen.description: The number of days since a user last listened to a story from this aggregation. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

following.description: Whether or not the user is following the aggregation. When changing affiliation status, the client is expected to toggle this value and then send the entire object back.

href.description: A link to more details about the program from the NPR Story API

id.description: A unique identifier for the aggregation (program)

notif_following.description: The topic in Firebase Cloud Messaging to which the device should subscribe if it supports notifications and the user wants notifications about the podcasts they follow.

notif_rated.description: The topic in Firebase Cloud Messaging to which the device should subscribe if it supports notifications and the user wants notifications about the podcasts they have highly rated.

rating.description: The user's average rating for this affiliation on a scale of 0-1. Absent if user never listened to the aggregation.

Affiliation.description: A program (aggregation) that a given user has shown an affiliation with

AggregationAudioItemListDocument.description: An array of audio recommendations with additional metadata about the aggregation they are associated with

affiliation.description: A unique identifier for the aggregation

station.description: Deprecated - clients should switch to use provider.

type.description: The type of list returned; will always be `aggregation`; useful for parsing search results

binge.description: One or more links to more unrated / unheard recommendations from this aggregation

image.description: One or more links to an image, along with metadata for display

more.description: One or more links to more episodes for the aggregation

web.description: One or more links to a web page for the item

album.description: Album information associated with the media

artist.description: The artist associated with the media

bingeAggId.description: Indicates which aggregration ID this recommendation was binged from

button.description: The text contents of an action button displayed on the client

date.description: The publication date in ISO-8601 format

duration.description: The length of the audio content in seconds

expires.description: The media's expiration date in ISO-8601 format

inFlow.description: Indicates the likelihood of being within a flow, useful for stateful playback buttons

label.description: The record label associated with the media

primary.description: Whether the audio is the primary audio of the story to which it is associated

program.description: The program associated with this media

provider.description: The name of the organization providing this media

rationale.description: A short summary of why this content was recommended

skippable.description: Whether the client should allow this content to be skipped

slug.description: A tag or category for this media

song.description: The song title associated with the media

streamGuid.description: The full GUID of the live stream returned within the recommendation

type.description: Help determine how content is displayed; for more information, see our design guidelines

uid.description: The media ID (for use in ratings objects)

unavailableText.description: The text contents to be displayed on the client if no media URLs are available

action.description: One or more links to be trigged by user actions, usually when a button is clicked

audio.description: One or more links to audio files for the item

binge.description: One or more links that start a flow-based experience focused on the aggregation

image.description: One or more links to an image, along with metadata for display

onramps.description: One or more shareable links for the item

ratings.description: This is an alternate URL to use to POST the ratings JSON. Difference between this and 'recommendations' is that 'ratings' will NOT return back recommendations of audio to play next.

recommendations.description: This is the URL that should be POSTed with the ratings JSON when this audio starts to play

stream-metadata.description: Links that can be polled to retreive current program metadata for a given stream

up.description: One or more links to more details about the program or podcast with which this item is associated

web.description: One or more links to a web page for the item

AudioLink.description: A link to audio files for the item

content-type.description: The MIME type of the response of this link; note that the enumerated list of possible values is not exhaustive and other MIME types could occur. The list should be treated as examples, rather than absolutes.

id.description: The globally unique identifier for the playlist.

title.description: The user-editable title of the playlist

band.description: The radio band for the organization if they are a station (AM or FM)

call.description: The call letter for the organization if they are a station

frequency.description: The radio frequency for the organization if they are a station

marketCity.description: The market city for the organization

marketState.description: The market state for the organization

displayType.description: How clients should display this channel in the station profile view

type.description: The type of list returned; will always be `category`

more.description: One or more links to more episodes for the aggregation

description.description: A longer description of what this channel focuses on

displayType.description: How clients should display this channel in the explore view

emptyText.description: Text for clients to display when the channel contains no recommendations

fullName.description: A short description of what this channel focuses on

id.description: The actual value that should be sent

refreshRule.description: In the explore view of a client, this field indicates how this channel should be refreshed.  This is an experimental field and subject to change, but for now zero indicates the client should refresh this channel every time a START rating is sent for a type=audio recommendation, while a 1 would indicate it can be refreshed much less often, such as on a 30 minute timer. 2 would indicate even less time to update, say every hour. We are still experimenting on the number of rules necessary and the best implementation for each type of rule.

attributes.description: Basic Swagger definitions used across Carbon services.

errors.description: A list of encountered errors, ignored on POST, PUT

href.description: A URL representation of the resource; should generally be ignored by clients unless noted otherwise

items.description: Basic Swagger definitions used across Carbon services.

links.description: Basic Swagger definitions used across Carbon services.

version.description: The version of the Collection.Doc+JSON spec being used

debug.description: Additional debug information if debug mode is turned on

Error.description: A serialized version of any error encountered when processing this request

ErrorDocument.description: A Collection.doc+JSON representation of an error result from an API call

attributes.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

errors.description: A list of encountered errors, ignored on POST, PUT

items.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

links.description: Ignore; will be empty for errors

countries.description: The list of countries as ISO 3166-1 abbreviations in which this media should be available if restricted is true

restricted.description: Whether any geographic restrictions should be applied

Geofence.description: The geographic restrictions that should be applied by the client before playing this media

ImageLink.description: An image, along with metadata for display

caption.description: The caption of the image; can be used as alternate text for accessibility

content-type.description: The MIME type of the response of this link; note that the enumerated list of possible values is not exhaustive and other MIME types could occur. The list should be treated as examples, rather than absolutes.

image.description: A unique identifier for the image

producer.description: The producer of the image; should be used for properly attributing the image when it exists

provider.description: The provider of the image; should be used for properly attributing the image when it exists

rel.description: The crop type or intended display style/size; note that the enumerated list of possible values is not exhaustive and other values could occur. The list should be treated as examples, rather than absolutes.

OrganizationCategoryAudioListDocument.description: An array of a certain category of audio recommendations from a provider

home.description: Flag indicating if the current view is in the user's home network

type.description: The type of list returned; will always be `organization`

OrganizationOverviewDocument.description: a variety of details about an organization including various lists of recent audio items

items.description: A list of separate documents which each include their own list of audio

image.description: One or more links to an image that can be as for branding (logo and small logo)

related.description: One or more links to related web pages for the organization (their twitter feed or facebook page for example)

web.description: One or more links to main page for the organization (their homepage for example)

OtherLink.description: An individual link from a list of links

content-type.description: The MIME type of the response of this link; note that the enumerated list of possible values is not exhaustive and other MIME types could occur. The list should be treated as examples, rather than absolutes.

linkText.description: Text recommended to accompany the link. For example, 'Read Story' with a full story link, or 'Read Transcript' with a transcript link.

pollInterval.description: When present, the recommended number of seconds between requests to the given URL

affiliations.description: An array of IDs & other data about collections or podcasts the user has ratings for; produced by the server and should be sent back as received; used for tracking program and podcast suggestions

channel.description: The channel this media item was pulled from

cohort.description: The primary cohort of the current logged-in user

duration.description: Number of seconds this audio piece is expected to last

elapsed.description: Number of seconds since the start of playback for this media item, as an integer

mediaId.description: The media id as given by the media object

timestamp.description: ISO-8601 formatted date/time; typically replaced by the client with the actual rating time

donateUrl.description: The URL of the organization's donate page

homepageUrl.description: The URL of the organization's homepage

logoUrl.description: A URL for an image of the organization's logo

RecommendationOrganization.description: Data about the organization with which this media is associated

type.description: The type of search result, which is either an AggregationAudioItemListDocument or an AudioItemDocument

SearchItemDocument.description: A search result, which is either an AggregationAudioItemListDocument or an AudioItemDocument

SearchListDocument.description: An array of aggregation or audio recommendations

items.description: A list of aggregation or audio items (recommendations)

query.description: The search terms used in the original request

400WithDocument.description: A bad request; generally, one or more parameters passed in were incorrect or missing
